content:
Certificate Certificate Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.Batch
Assembly:
Azure.Batch.dll

A certificate that can be installed on compute nodes and can be used to authenticate operations on a node.

Edit

In this Article

public class Certificate : IRefreshable, ITransportObjectProvider<CertificateAddParameter>, IInheritedBehaviors, IPropertyMetadata, IModifiable, IReadOnlyPublic Class Certificate
    Implements IRefreshable, ITransportObjectProvider(Of CertificateAddParameter), IInheritedBehaviors, IPropertyMetadata, IModifiable, IReadOnly
Inheritance

CertificateCertificate

Properties

CertificateFormat CertificateFormat

Edit

Gets the format of the certificate data.

public CertificateFormat? CertificateFormat { get; }Public ReadOnly Property CertificateFormat As CertificateFormat?
Value
Nullable<CertificateFormat> Nullable(Of CertificateFormat)

CustomBehaviors CustomBehaviors

Edit

Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this Certificate.

public IList<BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors { get; set; }Public Property CustomBehaviors As IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)
Value
IList<BatchClientBehavior> IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)

Remarks

These behaviors are inherited by child objects.

Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

Data Data

Edit

Gets the base64-encoded raw certificate data (contents of the .pfx or .cer file or data from which the Certificate was created).

public string Data { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Data As String
Value
String String

Remarks

This property is set when creating a new Certificate. It is not defined for certificates retrieved from the Batch service.

The maximum size is 10 KB.

DeleteCertificateError DeleteCertificateError

Edit

Gets the error that occurred on the last attempt to delete this certificate.

public DeleteCertificateError DeleteCertificateError { get; }Public ReadOnly Property DeleteCertificateError As DeleteCertificateError
Value
DeleteCertificateError DeleteCertificateError

Remarks

This property is null unless the certificate is in the DeleteFailed state.

Password Password

Edit

Gets the password to access the certificate private key.

public string Password { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Password As String
Value
String String

Remarks

This property is set when creating a new Certificate from .pfx format data (see CreateCertificate(Byte[], String) and CreateCertificate(String, String)). It is not defined for certificates retrieved from the Batch service.

PreviousState PreviousState

Edit

Gets the previous state of the certificate.

public CertificateState? PreviousState { get; }Public ReadOnly Property PreviousState As CertificateState?
Value
Nullable<CertificateState> Nullable(Of CertificateState)

Remarks

If the certificate is in its initial Active state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

PreviousStateTransitionTime PreviousStateTransitionTime

Edit

Gets the time at which the certificate entered its previous state.

public DateTime? PreviousStateTransitionTime { get; }Public ReadOnly Property PreviousStateTransitionTime As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Remarks

If the certificate is in its initial Active state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

PublicData PublicData

Edit

Gets the public part of the certificate as a string containing base-64 encoded .cer format data.

public string PublicData { get; }Public ReadOnly Property PublicData As String
Value
String String

State State

Edit

Gets the current state of the certificate.

public CertificateState? State { get; }Public ReadOnly Property State As CertificateState?
Value
Nullable<CertificateState> Nullable(Of CertificateState)

StateTransitionTime StateTransitionTime

Edit

Gets the time at which the certificate entered its current state.

public DateTime? StateTransitionTime { get; }Public ReadOnly Property StateTransitionTime As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Thumbprint Thumbprint

Edit

Gets the thumbprint of the certificate. This is a sequence of up to 40 hex digits.

public string Thumbprint { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Thumbprint As String
Value
String String

ThumbprintAlgorithm ThumbprintAlgorithm

Edit

Gets the algorithm used to derive the thumbprint.

public string ThumbprintAlgorithm { get; }Public ReadOnly Property ThumbprintAlgorithm As String
Value
String String

Url Url

Edit

Gets the URL of the certificate.

public string Url { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Url As String
Value
String String

Methods

CancelDelete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) CancelDelete(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Cancels a failed deletion of the certificate. This can be done only when the certificate is in the DeleteFailed state, and restores the certificate to the Active state.

public void CancelDelete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub CancelDelete(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

If you still wish to delete the certificate (instead of returning it to Active), you do not need to cancel the failed deletion. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate (see Delete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Cancels a failed deletion of the certificate. This can be done only when the certificate is in the DeleteFailed state, and restores the certificate to the Active state.

public Task CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Public Function CancelDeleteAsync(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.

Returns
Task Task

A Task object that represents the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

If you still wish to delete the certificate (instead of returning it to Active), you do not need to cancel the failed deletion. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate (see DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

The cancel delete operation runs asynchronously.

Edit

Adds the certificate to the Batch account.

Remarks

CommitAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) CommitAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Adds the certificate to the Batch account.

public Task CommitAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Public Function CommitAsync(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

Returns

Remarks

Delete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) Delete(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Deletes the certificate from the Batch account.

public void Delete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub Delete(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

The delete operation requests that the certificate be deleted. The request puts the certificate in the Deleting state. The Batch service will perform the actual certificate deletion without any further client action.

You cannot delete a certificate if a resource (pool or compute node) is using it. Before you can delete a certificate, you must therefore make sure that:

  • The certificate is not associated with any pools.
  • The certificate is not installed on any compute nodes. (Even if you remove a certificate from a pool, it is not removed from existing compute nodes in that pool until they restart.)

If you try to delete a certificate that is in use, the deletion fails. The certificate state changes to DeleteFailed. You can use CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) to set the status back to Active if you decide that you want to continue using the certificate.

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) DeleteAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Deletes the certificate from the Batch account.

public Task DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Public Function DeleteAsync(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

The delete operation requests that the certificate be deleted. The request puts the certificate in the Deleting state. The Batch service will perform the actual certificate deletion without any further client action.

You cannot delete a certificate if a resource (pool or compute node) is using it. Before you can delete a certificate, you must therefore make sure that:

  • The certificate is not associated with any pools.
  • The certificate is not installed on any compute nodes. (Even if you remove a certificate from a pool, it is not removed from existing compute nodes in that pool until they restart.)

If you try to delete a certificate that is in use, the deletion fails. The certificate state changes to DeleteFailed. You can use CancelDeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) to set the status back to Active if you decide that you want to continue using the certificate.

The delete operation runs asynchronously.

Refresh(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) Refresh(DetailLevel, IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Refreshes the current Certificate.

public void Refresh(DetailLevel detailLevel = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub Refresh(detailLevel As DetailLevel = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
detailLevel
DetailLevel DetailLevel

The detail level for the refresh. If a detail level which omits the Thumbprint or ThumbprintAlgorithm property is specified, refresh will fail.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

RefreshAsync(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) RefreshAsync(DetailLevel, IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Refreshes the current Certificate.
